headline: Thoma Bravo sold out of remaining 7% stake in Nasdaq, Bloomberg reports
summary: Private equity firm Thoma Bravo divested around 43M shares, or about 7.4%, of Nasdaq (NDAQ) in unregistered block trades on May 7 and May 13, selling its remaining stake for proceeds of about $3.4B, people familiar with the matter told Bloomberg’s Ryan Gould and Anthony Hughes. The private equity firm worked with JPMorgan Chase (JPM) on the sale, according to the sources. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, market-moving breaking financial news. headline: Nasdaq Resumes Trading in Damon Inc.
summary: NEW YORK, May 16, 2025 -- The Nasdaq Stock Market® announced that trading will resume in Damon Inc. at 9:00 a.m. Eastern Time on May 19, 2025. Trading in the company’s stock was halted on...
